French-style bakery with pastries, croissants, breads, sandwiches all baked fresh on premises. Open for breakfast and lunch, eat-in or takeaway. Bring the kids and eat in the small playroom upstairs. Gebroeders Niemeijer The Bakery Gebroeders Niemeijer is an artisanal French bakery located in the heart of Amsterdam. It is situated in a beautiful historic building with an original art deco ceiling. While visiting the shop or when sitting down to enjoy your meal you can look right into the open bakery and watch the bakers at work. Shortly after opening the bakery gained recognition as one of the best bakeries in the Netherlands, receiving international acclaim. We make all of our breads and pastries by hand and bake in a large stone-floored oven. We do not use additives or prepared products. We always choose quality, including organic ingredients where possible. Whether baguettes, sourdough loaves, croissants, macarons, éclairs, millefeuille, or financiers... all you taste in our bakery are good ingredients and pure flavors. In our bakery café and restaurant you can enjoy a classic French breakfast, lunch, or afternoon tea with delicious pastries. In addition to our breads, sandwiches, and pastries, we serve espresso from Turin; homemade jam, chutney, and marmalade; Mediterranean salads and soups; French cheeses; and charcuterie. The Niemeijer Brothers “Gebroeders Niemeijer” received its name from brothers Marco and Issa Niemeijer who opened the bakery in 2008 (the Dutch word “gebroeders” means “brothers”). Marco graduated from the Rietveld Art Academy and worked as a cook before opening the bakery. Issa studied sociology at the University of Amsterdam. During his studies he applied himself more and more to baking, already developing many of Gebroeders Niemeijer's unique recipes. Before opening his bakery, Issa worked with Gosselin in Paris, Menno 't Hoen in Rotterdam and Hartog Bakery in Amsterdam. From 2011 Issa continued as the sole owner of Gebroeders Niemeijer. A book about bread JAN Magazine: "A master class on bread" Read the review (PDF) Hiske Versprille, De Volkskrant: "Baker Issa Niemeijer is a radical artisan" Read the article Trouw: "Nr 1 best cookbook of the year, 2020" Read the article Epicurious: You'll gain a sense of what strengthens the crust, or what makes it more delicate ‐ what will deepen the flavor of your bread, or lengthen the freshness of your crumb. Read the article Jonah Freud, Het Parool: "It turns out that, like his baking, Issa’s writing is high quality. In his book he writes clearly and calmly how to make bread that is just as nice as in his bakery" Read the article De Telegraaf: "Issa shares his secrets in this new book, that may be rightfully called the new Amsterdam baking Bible" Read the article Elle Food: "This beautiful book is an ode to bread and describes Issa’s love of the craft, it teaches you how to make superb bread" Read the article Peper Hofstede, editor in chief, Eva Jinek: "This book is for the enthusiast – but who isn’t when in the weekend your home smells of fresh fougasse or pain au noix" Read the article AD: Read the article: How do you know if you are buying heathy bread? The colour doesn’t mean much Brood & Banket (Belgium): "A book about bread by the best baker in Amsterdam" Read the review Mangiare! NPO Radio 1 Listen to the interview with Issa Niemeijer-Brown. Delicious Magazine: "The name Niemeijer is a household word. From the basics of flour and sourdough to how to make a perfectly crispy crust and the best baguette" Kookboeken NWZ: "An ode to artisan baking. Issa writes with care and to the point. This is knowledge that is truly useful to the homebaker"; Read the review Soester Courant: Read the article (PDF) Friesch Dagblad: "A Book About Bread is at a whole different level, beautiful in its simplicity" Read the review (PDF) Bakkers in bedrijf: "The book radiates love of the craft" Read the article about the bakery and the review of the book Leeuwarder Courant: Read the article Knack Weekend (Belgium): "Beautiful and serene book" Read the article June tot Twaalf, Radio Noord Holland: Listen to the interview with Issa Niemeijer-Brown Ronald Giphart, author, De Gelderlander: "Truly an exceptional publication" Read the article (photo) NRC: "And look, the miracle happened: the dough becomes bread. And the bread was delicious" Read the review Product Range Our Bread All of our bread is shaped by hand, given a long slow development, and baked directly on the stone floor of the oven. The process creates the bread's characteristic crust, which bursts open during baking. We use our own recipes. Our sourdough breads (batards, boules, and nut breads) use our homemade French levain with a mild, subtle flavor. The bread is sturdy, but at the same time maintains the light and open structure typical of French bread. The flavor of the bread is mildly sour but more than anything else very full. It is flavorful on its own or a complement to any dish. Our current sourdough culture is eight and a half years old! We refresh it daily, keeping a portion of the old sourdough and adding fresh flour and water. In this way we maintain a specific and unique culture of natural yeast and bacteria. The bread has a slightly different flavor every day. This is caused by variations in the sourdough, flour, temperature, dough development, and shaping and baking of the breads. In our yeast breads (baguettes, épis and pavés) the taste of the grain is enhanced by the use of a minimal amount of yeast. This, combined with a long and slow development time and the gentle weighing and shaping of the loaves, creates bread with a light, nutty flavor and a crispy crust. We do not use any additives (no fats, lactose, bread enhancement powders, etc). The only ingredients in our breads are stone milled French flour, unrefined French sea salt from the Guerande, water, and sourdough or yeast. For the sourdough breads we use organic flour, for the baguettes and pavés certified label rouge, tradition Française. We do not knead our doughs, instead only mixing the ingredients. This allows the gluten structure to develop naturally during an extended development time. We fold the dough by hand midway through its development to align and reinforce the gluten structure – a process known in France as “giving the dough a rabat”. Keeping the Bread Our bread has a strong crust; keep it in a paper bag to ensure that the crust remains crunchy and the bread stays fresh. On humid days (as happens often in Amsterdam), or when eating the bread the next day, it is possible to refresh it by placing the bread in a hot oven (e.g. 220 degrees Celsius) for just a few minutes. The crust loses its excess humidity, making the bread crunchy again. € 3,70 yeast bread, white, development time ± 20-21 hours € 3,95 sourdough bread, white, development time ± 18-20 hours € 3,95 sourdough bread, grey, development time ± 18-20 hours € 3,95 sourdough bread, wholemeal, development time ± 18-20 hours € 5,40 sourdough bread, grey, with walnuts, development time ± 18-20 hours € 6,00 sourdough bread, grey with walnuts and figs, development time ± 18-20 hours € 4,20 sourdough bread, white, development time ± 20-24 hours € 6,50 sourdough bread, white, development time ± 18-20 hours € 5,95 sourdough bread, grey, development time ± 18-20 hours € 4,25 sourdough bread, white, with walnuts and blue cheese, development time ± 20-22 hours (available on Saturday) € 2,25 yeast bread, white, development time ± 21-28 hours € 3,25 yeast bread, white, development time ± 21-28 hours € 0,90 yeast bread, white, development time ± 24-28 hours € 0,50 yeast bread, development time ± 24-28 hours € 0,50 sourdough bread, development time ± 20-24 hours € 0,50 sourdough bread, development time ± 20-24 hours € 0,70 sourdough bread, grey with walnuts and figs, development time ± 20-24 hours € 4,75 sourdough bread, rye flour, wheat flour, development time ± 20-24 hours (available by advanced order) € 1,85 classic recipe from Rome, yeast bread, white, development time ± 24-28 hours (available Friday-Sunday or by advanced order) € 12,50 made with our own almond paste, development time ± 20 hours (available seasonally for Christmas and Easter) Viennoiserie We make our own croissants, pains au chocolat, Saint Joseph, pains aux raisins, brioches and brioches feuilletées based on classic French recipes. The flavors are enriched through long proofing times and a natural development of the dough, which is made with French flour. Our products never contain additives, preservatives or colorants. Our scones are based on an American recipe using crème fraiche in place of butter and milk. Just like the rest of the Viennoiserie, they are shaped by hand. At Gebroeders Niemeijer we use real butter, making our pastry uniquely flavorful. Conventional bakeries making croissants or brioches feuilletées use a modified butter product designed to withstand the shaping process without melting into the dough. While convenient, the modified product affects the flavor of the pastry. Because we use real butter there is a variation in our pastry from day to day, but we maintain a flavor, structure and quality that is difficult to find nowadays – even in France. Elle Food magazine selected our croissants as the only ones in the Netherlands which easily match the quality of their French counterparts, and ranked our croissants as number one in the magazine's National Culinary Top 100. € 1,85 € 1,95 € 2,75 € 2,95 € 1,70 € 2,10 € 1,95 Patisserie Our patisserie is also made by hand! From macarons to tartelettes au citron, canelés, and tarte tatin. From profiteroles, éclairs, and brownies to millefeuille, financiers, and galettes (Saint-Pierre). In winter we make our own gevulde speculaas - filled spice pastry, a Dutch specialty - with our homemade almond paste and home roasted spices. We use only our own original recipes and all pastry is made fresh every day. We also make a limited selection of chocolate and cookies. Chocolate truffles (caramel au beurre salé), saucisson de chocolat, sablés au chocolat et fleur de sel, sablés à l’orange et raisins, tuiles, and speculaasjes in the autumn and winter. We use no additives, preservatives or colorants. We make our own puff-pastry, grind our own nuts, and use high quality ingredients: Valrhona chocolate, Italian pastry flour, fresh vanilla, Sicilian lemons and organic seasonal (mostly local) fruit. On request we also make larger lemon, chocolate, fruit or walnut tarts, as well as large tarte tatin and large pochon. Next to bread, viennoiserie, and patisserie, we also carry other homemade products. Some are only available in the restaurant, such as our lemon-ginger lemonade or homemade ice tea. Others are available in the shop, such as our homemade jams and granola. To Order For pick-up the same day... phone the bakery! For pick-up the next day... send us an email at info@gebroedersniemeijer.nl. For large orders or for products that we do not make daily... also give us a call. Keep in mind that the breads take two days to make, from starting the dough to baking the loaves. Many pastries also require more than one day to make the dough or the fillings. Be sure to order well in advance! Breakfast & Lunch In our café restaurant you can enjoy a classic French breakfast, lunch or high tea – or simply sit and savor a coffee or a pastry. We make our own granola and muesli, served with fresh yoghurt or quark (fromage frais). Our salads and soups are also made fresh in house. All of our dishes and sandwiches are also available for take away. To complement our dishes we serve cheese from Amsterdam's renowned Fromagerie Kef, and charcuterie from Lindenhoff and Brandt en Levie. We make our own jams and marmalades. We work with organic salad, fruit, milk and yoghurt. Of course we emphasize our bread, but we also serve gluten free options such as salads and soups (...and for the sweet tooth, delicious macarons). In addition to a wide vegetarian assortment, our soups are always made without cream or milk products – our salads can also be adjusted to remove any dairy. We serve Costadoro coffee - an Italian espresso with an intense, robust, but never bitter, flavor. column32: Zomerijs/Winterkost means "summer ice cream and winter food". They have all the flavors you can think of and can even make a flavor on demand, but you have to tell the owner one or two days in advance. All the ice cream is homemade with natural ingredients for a reasonable price. In the winter typical Dutch winter food is served, like mashed potatoes with cabbage and smoked sausage.

column32: Very crowded little snack bar with Thai food. Not to be confused with the restaurant of the same owner, on the other side of the street. Try the chicken in oyster sauce. Welcome To Bird Thai Restaurant As soon as you enter our restaurant, you will experience the typical Thai atmosphere. The staff, the design and the food of course will take care of that. Our restaurant has 110 chairs divided over 3 seperate spaces. If you don’t succeed in getting a table right away, you can start with a drink at the bar. In the kitchen our Thai cooks are working only with fresh ingredients. Our specialities are the red and green curry sauces that can be combined with fish, prawns, beef, chicken or pork. In the Thai kitchen vegetables take a prominent place. That is why we have a great variety of vegetarian starters and main dishes. column157: Based on the price range of €12-17 for a meal, this place would be categorized as **cheap**.

column32: Kam-Yin is a remarkably popular Chinese-Surinamese restaurant because of its low prices and super-fast service. The food is absolutely delicious and some menus go for as low as €6. Service is nearly instant. But don't expect a romantic setting! Coke is handed out in cans, it's very noisy and the lighting is unflattering. The area near the window gives a bit of a quieter atmosphere than the back, so come early for a better seat. However, don't judge this place for something it doesn't try to be: for a cheap and fast joint, it's unmatched. Try the Sichuan Peking Duck if you're into Chinese (and into spicy food) or the ''nasi moksi meti'' (chicken, pork and rice) for Surinamese. Wash it down with a Fernandes (Surinamese soft drink).
column157: This place would be categorized as cheap.

column32: Slowly becoming an institution, this hugely popular Mandarin Chinese restaurant seems to have found a perfect balance between food, price and ambiance. The food is authentically Chinese, delicious, fresh and quickly served, and all of that for a bargain. Service is fast and rushed, but it doesn't feel like a snack bar. It has a stylish interior, and it's still one of those places you could bring a date to. The biggest problem is that ''everyone'' seems to know this place, so it's somewhat crowded and noisy, and you'll probably have to wait outside for a seat to become available. When you get in, order the oysters. They're a hit. New King Authentiek Chinees restaurant in het hart van Amsterdam. column32: This used to be just the little "Thai snackbar around the corner", but since a raving review in the local newspaper Het Parool, big crowds are waiting in line to get seated during dinnertime. The scenery is simple and the restaurant is very small and cramped. However, the hype is all about the food, which is absolutely mouth-watering. They have the usual Thai fare, but the dish to go for is the massaman curry, their specialty.
column157: This place would be categorized as **cheap** based on the price range of the meal (around 10 euro mark).

column32: Serves delicious pastas, made just as you want them. Choose a sauce, topping and pasta for a tasty, but well-priced meal.
Offers delicious sandwiches in freshly baked wraps and salads with a selection of home sauces. Prices vary from €3.95 for vegetarian wrap to €5.95 for Black-Angus Entrecôte wrap.

column32: Traditional Dutch, alongside French classics. Located in an historic building on a quiet side street near Central Station; it's off the beaten track so most of the diners are local. Open 6 days a week (not Mondays); a reservation is usually necessary.
Great spices and meat dishes, Indian/Indonesian food. Try the Nasi Goreng Rames.

column32: Oversized cups of coffee, muffins and bagels. Muffins, brownies, giant cookies, cheesecake and bagels spread with various toppings are served at reasonable prices to a clientèle that is a mix of locals and tourists. American themed. There are 3 locations in the city. Our bagels Authentic & traditional Ontbijt, lunch, brunch of als snack. Een echte classic New York style bagel kan altijd als je het ons vraagt! Daarvoor ben je bij Tony’s dan ook helemaal aan het juiste adres. Onze bagels zijn op authentiek, traditionele wijze bereid: handgerold, ondergedompeld in kokend water en vervolgens gebakken. We serveren deze klassiekers daarom ook al meer dan 20 jaar met liefde aan alle bagel liefhebbers in Amsterdam.

column32: This modern place was recently awarded with 2 Michelin stars, making it one of only 2 restaurants in Amsterdam to claim that recognition. Excellent service, high quality, modern cooking and (although perhaps subject to taste) a contemporary design interior. Wednesdays to Sundays it also serves lunch. Closed on Mondays. Call ahead. About Restaurant Beef Steak House is a legendary establishment of the famous international chain. This real man’s materia has become a kind of Mecca for fans and connoisseurs of American marbled beef steaks. At Beef Steak House, we serve classic marble steaks popular around the world: flavorful New York and lean Filet mignon, juicy Ribeye and impressive XXL Cowboy steak, as well as elite Kobe marble steaks. column32: The selling point of this cafe is its 360 degrees view over Amsterdam. Its interior is minimalist and stylish. A great place to have a Dutch cup of coffee while taking in the views. Unfortunately, it's only open at daytime as evenings are reserved for private events. Blue Amsterdam is een café en restaurant met een 360-graden uitzicht over de stad. Vanuit de dertig meter hoge glazen Kalvertoren in winkelcentrum Kalverpassage kun je heel veel moois van Amsterdam zien: het Rijksmuseum, de Munttoren, de Westerkerk, Carré, het Centraal Station, het Paleis op de Dam, de bloemenmarkt en nog veel meer. Neem de glazen lift naar boven en kijk je ogen uit. Iedereen is welkom! Je kunt zeven dagen per week bij ons terecht voor koffie, ontbijt, lunch, early dinner, borrel en taart. Onze kaart wisselt regelmatig. Je kunt gewoon binnen komen lopen zonder reservering. Onze enthousiaste mensen vertellen je graag meer over het uitzicht en de gebouwen die te zien zijn. Zowel overdag als ’s avonds kun je bij Blue met een groep terecht en (een deel) van onze ruimte besloten afhuren voor een lunch of een borrel. Wie zijn wij Toen wij in 2009 voor het eerst in de glazen lift in winkelcentrum Kalvertoren stapten, op de knop naar de derde etage drukten en we vervolgens vol verbazing uitkwamen in een moderne glazen ruimte met uitzicht over de stad wisten we het. Dit is het best bewaarde geheim van Amsterdam! Samen met ons lieve team doen we iedere dag ons best om onze gasten een fijne tijd te bezorgen. Wat ons betreft is Blue dé plek midden in het drukke hart van Amsterdam, waar je komt om te genieten van het uitzicht met een goede kop koffie, uitgebreide lunch of glas wijn. Hopelijk zien we je snel! menukaart De gerechten op ons menu zijn geïnspireerd door de vele culturen die samenkomen in onze stad. We houden van zelfgemaakt eten, kleurrijke borden, verrassende smaken en producten uit de buurt. bekijk menu Ben je op zoek naar een ruimte in het centrum van Amsterdam voor jouw groep? Dan kunnen wij je misschien verder helpen! Onze bovenverdieping leent zich op doordeweekse dagen heel goed voor (besloten) gelegenheden met uitzicht over de stad. Je kunt hier met een groep ontbijten, koffiedrinken, lunchen of borrelen. Er is ruimte voor maximaal 40 personen. Neem gerust contact met ons op om jouw ideeën te bespreken, voor meer informatie of om direct te reserveren. werken bij Ben je op zoek naar een leuke (bij)baan in een gezellig team? Stuur ons dan gerust een mail met jouw beschikbaarheid, motivatie en CV. We zijn altijd op zoek naar leuke mensen voor keuken en bediening. We horen graag van je! We zijn gek op Amsterdam en vertellen vol liefde over onze mooie stad. Wij vinden zelfs dat een bezoek aan Amsterdam bij Blue zou moeten beginnen. Je kunt alle hoogtepunten in een oogopslag zien. Waar je daarna naartoe moet? Wij vertellen het je graag!

A minimal art-deco interior next to Hotel d'Europe and a great view of where all the main canals come together (climb the stairs to the upper floor - the view is better and the crowds surprisingly thinner). Food is middling and on the pricy side, but it's a nice place to sip a cup of coffee or tea and read a newspaper. over café de jaren een Amsterdams café met een internationaal team Café de Jaren, geopend in 1990, is een licht en ruim café in het centrum van Amsterdam, gelegen tussen het Muntplein en het Muziektheater. Binnen vormen hoge plafonds en veel ruimte een aantrekkelijke ambiance. Aan de achterzijde bieden een balkon en een terras aan het water uitzicht op de Amstel. Wie per boot arriveert, kan onze eigen aanlegsteiger gebruiken. De Jaren dankt zijn populariteit aan de kwaliteit van het eten en drinken dat het serveert, de leestafel en de terrassen aan het water. En last but not least de gastvrijheid. cafe_nl_web_v2_18dec2019

One of Amsterdam's hidden secrets, Hannekes Boom is a cosy, somewhat ramshackle, bar with a waterfront along the IJ. It's a great place to just hang out and have a beer. Not for clubbers, but for those looking for a relaxing underground atmosphere and live music. It is centrally located, but off the tourist path, so it has a local feel to it. Outdoor seating is available, but you have to order your drinks inside. If you want to eat, make a reservation in advance (though the food is nothing special). The sun is out! Wij staan klaar, wanneer zie ik jou? Tot snel! Liefs, Hanneke

column32: A brewery, tasting room and beer shop all in one. De Prael gelooft in betekenisvol werk. Met een groep getalenteerde collega’s, onze helden, werken we aan ons eigen bier. De Prael biedt zo veel mogelijk werkplekken aan mensen die ergens anders lastig aan een baan komen. Geen dagbesteding of bezigheidstherapie maar gewoon stoer werk. Wij zijn trots op iedereen die ons bier schenkt en drinkt. Al sinds 2001.

column32: A very well stocked beer café, or actually beer tasting room (bierproeflokaal) in the centre of the inner city. 17 beers (usually from various countries) and a cider on draught, and about 250 different bottled beers offered. There is no music played, which makes for a very friendly and talkative atmosphere, and it has a separate non-smoking room. Bierproeflokaal In De Wildeman "Work is the curse of the drinking classes". - Oscar Wilde - Hét Biercafé in de Amsterdamse binnenstad. Gevestigd in een voormalige Amsterdamse distilleerderij, biedt 'In de Wildeman' een ideale gelegenheid om te genieten van uw bier in een authentieke omgeving. Wij serveren 18 bieren van de tap en hebben tevens een assortiment van 250 soorten bier op fles. Onze actuele Taplijst & Bierkaarten Laat je verrassen door onze variëteit aan bieren. Onze collectie bestaat voor het grootste deel uit Belgische en Nederlandse bieren zoals Trappisten maar ook Groot-Brittannië, Amerika en Duitsland zijn vertegenwoordigd. Onze taplijst wisselt voortdurend. Houd u daarom deze website nauwlettend in de gaten. Huidige Taplijst Alcohol & Glutenvrij Wilde Cider Wild Cellar Secrets En meer… Happenkaart ‘In De Wildeman’ Naast een mooi biertje hoort een lekkere snack. Ook voor de innerlijke mens zorgen wij graag. Onze happenkaart heeft voor ieder wat wils. Ambachtelijke Amsterdamse worst van Slagerij de Wit of heerlijke gerookte mosselen van Frank’s Smoke House. Bekijk hier alvast onze happenkaart. Nu te koop In De Wildeman Hoodie’s Bierliefhebbers opgelet. Ben jij fan van ‘In De Wildeman’ en draag je ons een warm hart toe? Wij hebben speciaal voor jullie nu de nieuwe In De Wildeman Merchandise. Hoodie’s waarin gedronken mag worden. Ze kosten 47,50 euro per stuk. Verkoop aan de bar of vraag de bediening. Bedrijfsborrel organiseren? Iets te vieren met collega’s? Nieuwjaarsborrel, kerstborrel of gewoon een andere goede reden om met elkaar te genieten van een hapje en drankje. ‘In De Wildeman’ is een unieke en sfeervolle locatie in hartje Amsterdam. Vul heel eenvoudig even ons bedrijfsborrel formulier in en wij nemen contact met je op.

Wynand Fockink is a distillery that started in 1679. They offer distillery tours, but you must reserve at least a week in advance as they fill up quickly. It is also a tasting room and a liquor store. They have numerous liquors, brandies, and ''jenevers'' and encourage you to try them all. It is traditional to stoop and sip the first drink and not spill. Great liquors, and a good time in the back alleys of Amsterdam. column32: Close to the southern part of the Canal District. Alternative music and cosy atmosphere also in the evenings.

Authentic Irish pub with food. Mix of expatriates, locals and tourists, friendly staff. Situated on a canal off the Zeedijk, close to Centraal Station and Warmoesstraat. Open every night, live music in the week-ends and large-screen television. join the craic! Welcome to Molly Malone's Irish Pub in Amsterdam! Below (or via the navigation top left) you will find our contact details, our beverage brands and whiskey list, upcoming events & live sports. Hope to see you soon! OPENING HOURS 2022 Tue - Fri 15.00 – 01.00 Sat & Sun 12.00 noon - 01.00 LOCATION Oudezijds Kolk 9 1012AL Amsterdam The Netherlands Let's be buddies! Follow us on: THE PUB LIVE SPORTS | SNACKS | 75+ WHISKEYS | CENTRALLY LOCATED | FAMILY FRIENDLY | FREE WIFI Molly’s is located in an historic, former Warehouse on the corner of Amsterdam's famous Red Light District and just a couple of minutes walk to the central train station. Our canal-side terrace faces out towards the St. Nicholas church and is a hot-spot for locals and tourists to relax and take in the lazy life of this delightful Dutch neighbourhood. The interior is lined with old whiskey barrels and aged Irish antiques, and the magnificent oak bar captures the spirit of Irish history in the heart of old Amsterdam. You’ll encounter all kinds of characters in Molly’s with a happy buzz of accents from all over the world. Molly's serves as a base for expats looking to find like-minded people. We also work together with meet-up groups who enjoy using our venue as a meeting point and living room in the centre of the city. Molly’s is also very family-friendly and we offer a range of games to keep the kids entertained while you relax and enjoy the best part of your day. Sports fans can follow their passions on our big screen which shows all major sports events including Irish GAA matches. Everyone is welcome here and we aim to wrap a warm, traditional Irish welcome around your every visit. Here's what one of our customers had to say about us on Tripadvisor: ''As a frequent visitor to Amsterdam, Molly Malone's is at the top of my list for great food, casual dining and a good selection of Irish beer on tap. Conveniently located on a canal just across Central Station, you can enjoy dinner outside watching the party boats cruise by or inside in a pub atmosphere where european football is on the big screen. I usually order the ribs - Molly's signature dish, but have enjoyed the salmon as well. The wait staff is friendly - mostly Irish, and efficient. I look forward to my next visit!'' our brands Draught pints Selected bottles LIVE sports & events calendar Tip: save the date in your (mobile) calendar. Click on the event and add to calendar, and don't forget to share it on social media! live Sports games Soccer, Gaelic Football, Hurling, Rugby... Molly's has three HD projectors with big screens + 2 HD Telly's where we show the all your favourite matches in high quality. Check the calendar above for the matches! SPECIAL events Molly's is a great place to party for the likes of St. Patricks Day, Halloween, Christmas, King's Day and much more! We really go all out for these events, we promise! Check the calendar & save the date.

column32: The "Downtown" branch, as opposed to the "Uptown" in Zuid, has more of a party vibe. Both hostels are known for their laid-back atmosphere, bars and indoor smoking areas. Free extras, check out the facility page on their website. Come experience the real hustle and bustle of Amsterdam at The Flying Pig hostels. Our three youth hostels are world famous for their relaxed atmosphere in a true Amsterdam style. The Flying Pig bars are the best place in town to meet other like-minded travelers, have a drink, a smoke, or an unforgettable party. Our rooms and dorms however, are kept silent and noise free to ensure a good night sleep. All essentials are included in the price of your hostel stay: clean bed linen, Wi-Fi, under-bed storage lockers (bring your own padlock), city maps, local hot-spot guides and of course the recommendations of our staff. Our hostels have too a fully equipped kitchen for you to cook your own meals and store your food. Buffet breakfast is available on site for just €7 per day. Forgot your towel, padlock or toothbrush? We've got you. You can pick these up cheap from our reception store.

column32: The hotel is a comfortable 2 star hotel situated only a 5 minute walk from Amsterdam’s Central Station. 中国尊龙凯时（简称“中国尊龙凯时”）成立于1996年。二十多年来，中国尊龙凯时始终坚持“思想决定一切，让我们做行业第一”的企业理念，坚持“团结、拼搏、开拓、创新”的企业精神，扎实经营，锐意进取，现已发展成为集商超连锁、商业综合体、地产开发、星级酒店、旅游康养、物业管理、商贸物流、白酒产业、金融投资于一体的多领域、多元化、多业态的大型企业集团。 中国尊龙凯时在坚持以商超连锁和商业综合体为主的同时，不断完善品牌经营架构，积极推进多业态同步发展。“东方购物广场”、“东方城商业综合体”、“奥润特超市”、“东方酒店”、“东方郡住宅”、“润宝农业”、“大田庄旅游”、“酱督酒业”等品牌，在区域行业内一直保持了市场主导地位，赢得了广大消费者的普遍认可和信赖。集团先后被授予“山东省工人先锋号”、“山东省消费者满意单位”、“山东省价格诚信单位”、“食安山东食品流通示范单位”、“重合同守信用企业”、“百佳诚信企业”、“临沂市消费者满意单位”、“济宁市消费者满意单位”、“振兴沂蒙劳动奖状”、“临沂市模范班组”等多项省市级荣誉称号。 中国尊龙凯时以“立足山东、走向全国”为发展目标，以贴近民生，服务大众为品牌宗旨。鲁南地区首个商业综合体“东方不夜城”的成功开发，成为集团业态转型升级的重要标志。集团相继开发建设了“北城东方城”、“经开区东方城”、“费县东方城”、“费县蓝色港湾广场”等大型商业综合体；“北城新区东方慧景高端写字楼”、“东方商贸物流产业园”、“经开区东方郡高档住宅区”等项目。与此同时，集团顺应形势，抓住机遇，向现代农业和旅游产业进军，成立山东大田庄旅游开发有限公司，投资建设东方·大田庄旅游度假景区和大型田园综合体。项目开发建设坚持“生态旅游+现代农业”的新乡村特色，原生态环境，高起点规划，高标准建设，高效率运营。凭借得天独厚的环境优势和热点资源，融合了旅游、农业、休闲度假、酒店餐饮、养老养生、渔业观光等项目的全域立体开发，打造独具东方特色的田园综合体和旅游度假景区。“大田庄国际会议中心”、“润宝农业”、“紫荆庄园”、“颐心养生苑”、“游客中心”等项目也先后投入运营。2019年集团成立酱督酒业有限公司，主营酱督品牌酱香型系列白酒，酒业公司的成立和运营，开启了集团战略发展的新模式。 新时代，新作为，新征程，新跨越。今天，中国尊龙凯时已进入“多元+规模+品牌”的战略发展阶段，形成了完整的产业链、成熟的经营模式、优秀的企业文化和卓越的品牌影响力。中国尊龙凯时将不忘初心，牢记使命，以发展为重心，紧贴民生，多元服务，创新发展，持续打造企业核心竞争力；实现先进管理方式和战略发展模式的深层次转变，不断稳固区域性行业龙头地位，努力实现持续、健康、稳步发展的百年东方梦。 [查看详情] NEWS INFOMATION 二月东风起，正是春归时。2024年2月26日，中国尊龙凯时“对标... 时间：2024-03-01 2024年2月8日上午，薛城区委书记巴海峰到奥润特超市枣庄万... 时间：2024-02-12 2024年2月7日，临沂市市场监管局党组书记、局长徐涛到三官... 时间：2024-02-08 2024年1月31日上午，备受全市人民瞩目的临沂市第二十届人... 时间：2024-02-05 查看更多 INDUSTRY 查看更多 版权所有?山东中国尊龙凯时 备案号：鲁ICP备10210089号

Experience the Best Hostel Stay at White Tulip Hostel in Amsterdam When planning your trip to Amsterdam, finding the right accommodation is key to a memorable experience. This blog post will guide you through everything you need to know about staying at the White Tulip Hostel. From its prime location in the heart of Amsterdam to the 2024 prices and booking tips, this article is worth reading to ensure a hassle-free and enjoyable stay in one of the city’s most vibrant hostels. The White Tulip Hostel offers accommodation in a prime area, allowing you to fully experience the city’s night life. Read on to find out more about the best ways to stay in Amsterdam and enjoy everything near the White Tulip Hostel. Why Choose White Tulip Hostel in Amsterdam? White Tulip Hostel is an ideal choice for both solo travelers and larger groups looking to explore Amsterdam without breaking the bank. Located in the heart of the city, this hostel is situated conveniently near the train station and offers a friendly atmosphere. With affordable nightly prices, shared bathroom facilities, and easy access to major attractions, this hostel caters to both backpackers and budget-conscious travelers. Whether you’re a solo adventurer or traveling in a group, White Tulip Hostel provides a welcoming and convenient base for your Amsterdam adventure. Location: Right in the Heart of Amsterdam Situated right in the middle of Amsterdam’s vibrant Red Light District, White Tulip Hostel is a stone’s throw away from many of the city’s top attractions. This property is just a 5-minute walk from Dam Square, the Flower Market, and Madame Tussaud’s. Amsterdam Central Station is also only a 5-minute walk away, making it easy to explore the city’s nightlife, historical sites, and cultural landmarks. Surrounded by bars, coffee shops, and bustling nightlife, this perfect location offers the true essence of Amsterdam. Accommodation Options at White Tulip Hostel White Tulip Hostel offers a variety of accommodation options to suit different needs and budgets. From shared dormitories to private rooms, there’s something for every traveller. The dorms, which can accommodate up to 10 people, are equipped with free lockers (bring your own padlock) and the bathrooms are shared, ensuring a communal and social atmosphere. For those who prefer more privacy, the private rooms offer a quieter retreat. Additionally, the hostel provides free Wi-Fi, a 24-hour receptionist, security lockers, and an outdoor terrace for guests to relax and socialize. Bicycle hire is also available for those who wish to explore the city on two wheels, making it an ideal hotel for any traveller looking to experience Amsterdam. Experience the Best Hostel Stay at White Tulip Hostel in Amsterdam Hostel welcome there! Are you looking for an ideal location to spend the night in Amsterdam on a limited budget? With us you are at the right place! How to Check Availability and Book Your Stay Checking availability and booking your stay at White Tulip Hostel is straightforward. You can visit booking.com to find the latest prices and availability. Make sure to book early, especially during peak tourist seasons, to secure your bed. The hostel offers flexible booking options and accepts major credit cards for payment. The hostel also has a pub bar restaurant and dorm options to cater to different needs. Additionally, the hostel provides services for luggage storage, ensuring a hassle-free experience. House Rules and What to Expect To ensure a pleasant stay for all guests, White Tulip Hostel has a set of house rules. The check-in process is smooth, with staff available 24 hours at the reception. Please note your arrival time and be aware the hostel enforces a strict no-drugs policy. Smoking is allowed only on the designated smoking terrace. The hostel also has quiet hours to respect all guests’ rest. Showers and toilets are kept clean for guest comfort. The staff are known for being accommodating, contributing to the hostel’s positive guest reviews. Additionally, the hostel’s cancellation policy is straightforward. Attractions Near White Tulip Hostel Staying in the hostel puts you within walking distance of many major attractions. Explore the Anne Frank House, the Van Gogh Museum, and the Heineken Experience. White Tulip Hostel includes proximity to Dam Square, the Red Light District, and various museums and parks. You’ll never run out of things to do and see in Amsterdam. Free walking tours, attraction discounts, and no hidden fees are also available, adding extra value to your stay. The hostel offers accommodation for larger groups. Experience the Best Hostel Stay at White Tulip Hostel in Amsterdam Dining Options and the Irish Pub The hostel features an on-site Irish pub, Slainte, which offers a lively atmosphere and serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Guests enjoy a 15-25% discount at the pub, which has 6 TVs and serves breakfast with an authentic Irish ambiance. Enjoy happy hours with a wide selection of beers, including Heineken. Larger groups and solo travellers alike will find the on-site bar a fantastic place to meet other like-minded mates and enjoy the social atmosphere of the hostel. Tips for Staying at Hostels in Amsterdam Staying in a hostel can be a unique and rewarding experience. Here are some tips to make the most of your stay at White Tulip Hostel: Bring your own padlock for the lockers. - Take advantage of the communal areas to meet fellow travelers. It’s in the middle of the Red Light District, so there’s never a dull moment. - Respect the house rules and quiet hours. - Keep your valuables safe and be mindful of your belongings. Also, remember to keep your beds reserved to avoid any mix-ups. - Use the hostel’s free Wi-Fi to plan your daily adventures. The Rokin underground station is close by for easy transport. - This is honestly the best hostel I have ever stayed at, offering great value and a fantastic atmosphere. How to Get to White Tulip Hostel Getting to White Tulip Hostel is easy, whether you’re arriving by plane, train, or bus. From Schiphol Airport, located 20 km away, you can take a direct train to Amsterdam Central Station, followed by a short walk to the hostel, which is almost at your doorstep. If you’re arriving by bus, the central bus station is also nearby. The hostel is well-connected by public transportation, whether you’re headed to Damstraat or any other part of the city, making it convenient to reach from any part of the city. Costs are minimal, typically just a few euros per person. Summary White Tulip Hostel is centrally located in Amsterdam, making it easy to explore the city. - The hostel offers a variety of accommodation options, including shared dorms with top bunk and private rooms. - Booking in advance through booking.com is also possible, but booking direct via this website gives you an extra Discount! - The hostel enforces house rules to ensure a pleasant stay for all guests, including child guests. - Major attractions like Dam Square, the Flower Market, and the Van Gogh Museum are within walking distance. - The on-site Irish pub provides meals, a lively atmosphere, guest discounts, and has 6 TVs. Slaínte! - Follow tips for staying in hostels to enhance your experience. - The hostel is easily accessible from Schiphol Airport and Amsterdam Central Station. - Positive guest reviews highlight the hostel’s central location, friendly staff, and comfortable, clean rooms. - By following this guide, you’ll be well-prepared for a fantastic stay at White Tulip Hostel in Amsterdam. Enjoy amenities like the Irish pub that has 6 TVs and nearby coffeehouses. Remember to check for any tax-related information and confirm your booking via email. Enjoy your trip! Ask for the happy hours, buy one Heineken get two. Come in and have a good time!!! We will be waiting for you!

column32: Just a few minutes walking from Central Station and Dam square Dear guest, we regret to inform you that CityCenter B&B is currently closed. However, we invite you to experience the charm of the new Amsterdam Bed and Breakfast Canal View instead. Amsterdam Bed and Breakfast CityCenter is just a few minutes walk from Central Station and Dam Square. My B&B is a quiet oasis, right in the historical centre of Amsterdam. We offer cozy and comfortable rooms, plus a personal touch you won’t find at regular hotels. I hope to welcome you soon. Sint Jacobsstraat and the house are very quiet. The Amsterdam b&b CityCenter is in a 19th century original monumental downtown house. So, if you want to relax after a full day or a long night, this is the place to be. When you wake up, you can expect a creamy and delicious breakfast served in the room. With free internet WiFi and all tourist information available in the Amsterdam b&b, you have all the ingredients to discover the best that Amsterdam has to offer. From its first days in the 11th century, Amsterdam has been a free and slightly rebellious city. Here you'll find yourself in the very heart of it. You have all the tourist attractions, museums and nightlife at hand. Whether it's the Dam square, Beurs van Berlage , the famous Jordaan area, Anne Frank's house, the flower market or the gay Warmoesstraat, it is all not more than a few minutes walking. Feel free to ask me for any advice. I speak English, Italian, German and Dutch. As you are in the Venice of the north, a canal tour is one of the best ways to discover the unique feeling of this city. With central station just around the corner, you can go everywhere you like. Bed and breakfast Amsterdam CityCenter offers also bike, city tour, countryside tour, museum reservation service. 13-02-2019 Every third Sunday of the Month, the Museumplein will be loaded up with Art, Craft and Fashion with local artist. Delightful stands loaded with unique and trendy items. Next Museum Market will be on Sunday 17 February 2019. 12-03-2019 The Keukenhof, alias the garden of Europe, is the largest flower park of the world and is going open again from 21-03-2019 to 19-05-2019. More than 7 million flowers in bloom. If you are visiting Amsterdam, you cannot miss it. An explosion of colors and perfumes.

column32: Clean rooms and friendly staff. Welcome to Delta Hotel Amsterdam Take one step outside and find yourself right in the middle of Amsterdam’s bustling city centre. The best price/quality ratio you’ll find in this area. A stone's throw away from the Delta Hotel you find the Dam Palace, the Red Light District, the main shopping streets and Central Station. The perect starting point for your Amsterdam adventure. We provide free WiFi in our common areas. Our hotel rooms are clean, neat and vary from single rooms to quad rooms for groups and families. Every room is unique because of the building’s original architecture. The rooms are recently renovated and therefore in good condition. Had a good night's sleep? Come and join our breakfast in the restaurant, with a beautiful view on the lively Damrak. The perfect place to make plans for the rest of your day. General Information and Policies Address: Damrak 42-43, 1012 LK, Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Tel: +31 (0)20 620 2626 Email: info@delta-hotel.nl Check in time: 15:00 Check out time: 11:00 (Unauthorized late check out incurs a fee equal to a 1 night's stay) Breakfast time: 07:30 - 10:00 Front desk: 24/7 Number of rooms: 48 Room types: Single, Double/Twin, Triple, Quad, 6 persons and 8 persons. All rooms are private with private facilities. All rooms are Non-Smoking Accepted cards: For reservations: Visa and Mastercard For payments (in property): Visa, Mastercard, Amex, Maestro, Vpay Deposits: Upon check in a deposit of €30.- will be required as a guarantee for extra charges you may or may not incur such as the loss of your room key, the remote control for the TV etc. The deposit can be provided in cash or as a pre-authorization on your credit card (No Bank Cards). The deposit is returned upon check out. Payment: Payment for the room is due upon check in. Upon check in, Pre-Paid reservations will be charged the City Tax(7%) and Tourist Fee (€3.- per person, per night) Pre-Paid travel agent reservations are required to provide a valid voucher. Pre payments for credit card guaranteed reservations can be done by bank transfer only, no later than one week prior to arrival date. Bank details will be provided upon request. Different policies apply to groups. Credit Card Guarantee: Upon booking, you are required to provide valid credit card details. The provided card details are used only to guarantee your reservation and not for payments, down payments or deposits. One week prior to arrival, your card will be pre-authorized for the full amount of the first night as a guarantee. The pre-authorization will be used only in case of late cancellation or no-show. In case your card was declined, we will notify you and allow for a 24 hours time frame to resolve the issue. If the issue is not resolved within that time frame, your reservation will be cancelled. Different policies apply to groups. Cancellations: You may cancel your reservation, free of charge, up to 72 hours prior to arrival date. Late cancellations or no-shows are subjected to a charge of the full price of the first night. Reservations via travel agent, online or otherwise, must be cancelled via the travel agent. Direct reservations, via email or in property, must be cancelled via written communication (email). Different policies apply to groups. Groups: Group reservations are reservations of 5 rooms or more. Payment is due, in full, no later than 1 month prior to arrival. Cancellation is free of charge up to 1 month prior to arrival. Late cancellations or no-shows are subjected to a charge of the full amount of the reservation. Travel agent based reservations - Cancel by agent. Direct reservations - Cancel by written communication. Additional policies: Children - 1 child, up to the age of 4, stays for free in existing bedding. Baby cot is subject to availability. Pets - Pets of all kinds and sizes are not allowed. Age - All guests under the age of 18 who are traveling without an adult, must provide parents authorization to travel. Authorization must be provided in advance, by email and it must include a scanned copy of parents' passport. Visitors - Visitors are strictly forbidden in guests' rooms. Illegal activities - Delta hotel will not tolerate illegal activities of any kind and will immediately remove guests who are engaged is such activities with no warning and no refund for nights not stayed. Responsibility- We decline responsibility for items left in the rooms, safe or luggage room. Your reservation with Delta Hotel is a legal binding contract on which the general terms and conditions apply. The Uniform Conditions for the Hotel and Catering Industry form an integral part of these conditions. Where these conditions differ from the Uniform Conditions for the Hotel and Catering Industry, these conditions apply. Delta Hotel reserves the right to change the conditions at any time without notice.

column32: Direct bookers get up to 5% discount per night - A free welcome drink - Early check in from 2pm - Nearby parking available - Late check out until 12pm - Scroll down Colourful with a Scottish twist The Highlander Hotel in Amsterdam is a creative, stylish boutique hotel with a great vibe. A mishmash of colours, patterns and design represents all of the wonders of Amsterdam. Floors, walls and ceilings are painted, carpeted or otherwise covered in hues of red, yellow, emerald green and more. Turn your trip into a journey: let our hotel inspire you to be the most colourful version of yourself. Lively, creative and vibrant: this is the Highlander Amsterdam Staying at the Highlander Amsterdam is an experience. All of our rooms have different designs and our floors are colour-coded: this way the hotel expresses Amsterdam’s diversity and energy. Luxurious, king size beds of the highest quality, spacious bathrooms with rain showers and very unique, colourful designs: the Scottish Cottage, Kilt Townhouse and Highland Mansion have everything you need to make your stay one to remember. Super service, a personal touch and a bit of fun At the Highlander Amsterdam, we work with highly trained professionals who do everything they can to make you feel welcome. Like the hotel, our staff is creative and friendly, adding a bit of humour to our service. We aim to delight and inspire our guests. Special offers Enjoy the stylish creativity of the Highlander Amsterdam! We’ve put together a few great offers to make the most of your stay. Exclusively available through this website. Book your stay today and get the best deal! Bar & lobby Like true Scotsmen, we appreciate a stiff bevvy (drink). Come have a dram in our well-stocked bar or sit down for a chat in our lobby. Our staff can tell you all about where to go, what to see and what to do in Amsterdam. Ask away!

column32: Includes a free breakfast. '''NOTE: Temporarily closed until the end of 2014.''' Binnenkort een mannenweekend op de planning staan? Wij geven tips voor leuke activiteiten én kleding! Eindelijk heb je een weekendje met je vrienden gepland. Heerlijk even weg met z’n allen en tijd voor échte mannenactiviteiten. column32: Friendly staff, bar open all night. The main tourist spots The hotel is just a walking distance from many of the main tourist spots that Amsterdam has to offer. Such as the Rembrandtplein – a vibrant square with a wide choice of bars, restaurants, clubs and cafes. Only minutes from the square is the Flower Market, always worth a visit for it’s variety of brightly coloured flowers only native to Holland. Shopping The shopping street Kalverstraat stretches from the Flower market thru to Dam square ( home to The Royal Palace ) then continues on the Nieuwendijk thru to Central Station. And then last but not least the notorius Red Light District, another world, yet only ten minutes from the hotel. Public transport Public transport is within easy reach whether you take the tram or metro. Both serving a direct line to the RAI congress centrum or Schiphol airport. Cycling is very popular in Amsterdam and a great way to see the city. A rental shop is just around the corner from the hotel. Or if you prefer to view the city from the canals you can take the canal bus that stops directly behind the hotel. There is also a 24 hour parking facility nearby. The hotel is very proud on its unique location.

column32: A boutique hotel that consists of a row of 17th century buildings along the Singel canal. It has 93 rooms and 2 suites. It recently renovated 75 of its rooms. Free Wi-Fi. Imagine yourself in a truly authentic Amsterdam ambiance in this beautiful seventeenth-century building along Amsterdam’s oldest canal: the Singel. Dream away with the richly coloured interior, the crystal chandeliers, the luxurious fabrics and the expressive prints. None of the 91 rooms and two suites in our hotel are the same, each and every one of them has been lovingly designed and decorated. Hotel Estheréa will allow you to relax and it’s also the perfect starting point for discovering and exploring the city, as it’s located right in the very heart of Amsterdam. In short, the perfect stay for either a short or a long getaway in Amsterdam. Can we look forward to seeing you soon? This boutique hotel has been run by a family for more than 80 years. Quite a few things have changed over the years. The premises started out as a guest house with 12 rooms and has now been developed into a luxury gem with 91 rooms and two suites. The building is now included on UNESCO’s world heritage list and has undergone a significant transformation. However, the one thing which has definitely remained over the course of time is a true family feeling, personal attention, service, authenticity and an eye for detail. And you don’t just see that when you enter our hotel, you will feel it too. Library with books, newspapers and magazines Coffee, tea and hot chocolate 24/7 bar (cocktails from 17:00 to 01:00 hours) Meeting rooms for a maximum of 18 people Bike rentals Lounge with views across the canal Snacks Free Wi-Fi throughout the entire hotel Gym Underground parking Hotel Estheréa has 91 luxuriously furnished rooms and two colourful suites. Each room is unique, literally every detail has been carefully considered. All rooms are accessible by lift and the hotel is completely non-smoking. This hotel’s charm is in the historic building and its history, so it’s quite possible for there to be differences in the room sizes. Classic rooms are at least 13 m², Luxury rooms 20 m² and the Suites are either 30 m² or 55 m². Please be informed that till th end of March 2024 we will renovate mulitple rooms. Some construction noise may be unavoidable at times on weekdays during office hours after 10am. All rooms are equipped with: Book a room View our room types Are you planning on organising a meeting? We have three stylish meeting rooms available for your use, suitable for groups of up to 18 people. These rooms are equipped with all possible facilities and come with an extensive coffee and tea buffet with some sweet delicacies. We can also organise your breakfast, lunch or drinks. Take a look at the meeting possibilities and let us know about your requirements. All the meeting rooms have air conditioning, Wi-Fi and a LCD screen. A beamer with a screen and flipchart are available free of charge. Are you travelling by car? You also have the option of using our underground parking facilities for a total of €55,- per day. The entrance to the car park is at Spuistraat 258. Do you fancy taking a moment to relax with a good glass of wine? Or perhaps allow yourself to get into an exuberant mood with a delicious cocktail? Whatever you feel like, the bartenders in Maria’s bar, named after Hotel Estheréa’s founder Maria Flieger-Gruyters, will always be on hand to serve you up a refreshing drink. Our bar is exclusively open to hotel guests. Absolutely ideal for escaping the hustle and bustle of the city. Discover our surprising drinks menu, or enjoy the snacks from our small menu. How about a delicious piece of Dutch cheese or a bitterbal? That should definitely form part of your stay with us. Maria’s Bar is stylish and cosy and open 24/7. Our kitchen closes at 23:00 hours and we serve cocktails from 17:00 to 01:00 hours. What can we get you? More than 4.900 reviews More than 4.150 reviews More than 1.000 reviews

column32: The Amsterdam Botanical Gardens -'Hortus' as it is called by locals - was formerly the Botanic Garden of the University of Amsterdam. It is one of the oldest botanical gardens in the world. Nowadays it is an independent organisation. The collection of the garden consists of more than 6.000 species. The garden regurlary holds extra exhibitions and music performances.

Het Scheepvaartmuseum reopened in late 2011 following major renovations. Stimulating, interactive exhibitions allow visitors to explore 500 years of maritime history. The building, called the Arsenal, is impressive. The Central Square, the indoor courtyard can be visited for free and takes your breath away. Also the museum shop, the restaurant and the library are open to the public free of charge. Ontdek 500 jaar Nederlandse maritieme geschiedenis en de verbinding met de samenleving van nu en van de toekomst. Het Scheepvaartmuseum bewaart één van de grootste en meest vooraanstaande maritieme collecties ter wereld en bevat onder andere schilderijen, scheepsmodellen, navigatie-instrumenten en zeekaarten. Food for Thought De tentoonstelling 'Food for Thought' geeft bezoekers een kijkje in de wereld van de grootschalige voedselproductie. Waar komt ons voedsel eigenlijk vandaan? Waar wordt het geproduceerd? En hoe verplaatst het zich over de wereld? Met werk van fotograaf en documentairemaker Kadir van Lohuizen. Redders op zee Met de fotografietentoonstelling 'Redders op zee' viert Het Scheepvaartmuseum 200 jaar Koninklijke Nederlandse Redding Maatschappij (KNRM). De tentoonstelling zet vrijwilligers van de KNRM, de 'Redders op zee', in de schijnwerpers en laat zien wie deze mensen zijn VOC-schip Stap aan boord van het VOC-schip de Amsterdam: een belangrijk onderdeel van je museumbezoek. Aan boord is er van alles te leren over VOC-schepen en de geschiedenis van de VOC.

column32: Fabulous little bar in the traditional "brown cafe" style in a fairly residential district near Artis Zoo. All the food is homemade daily; you really can't go wrong with any part of the menu. No reservations necessary, but seating is limited to a small bar and 8 tables of varying sizes upstairs. Great place to spend an evening. Open for lunch and dinner.

Former coffeehouse for harbour labourers. Now a small atmospheric restaurant in the east of the city centre. Mainly visited by locals. Different menu every evening, ranging from €10 to €15 for a main course. Not possible to make reservations and you may have to share a table with other guests.

Cafe Kadijk is a small Indonesian restaurant that offers good food at a decent price. The restaurant has a coffee shop vibe and is located in a "trendy" area. Just outside Amsterdam's city center, it is a bit of a walk away from the more touristy areas of the city. Patio dining and indoor dining are both available. Drinken & Indisch eten Café Kadijk is een klein, gezellig eetcafé gelegen aan het Kadijksplein tegenover de Scharrebiersluis. Het plein is fraai opgeknapt en biedt in het voorjaar en de zomer plaats aan prachtige, zonnige terrassen. Bij Café Kadijk worden dagelijks Indische maaltijden geserveerd, waarbij het Indisch Bordje een aanrader is! Dagelijks geopend van 17:00 tot 01:00 uur. De keuken sluit om 22:00 uur. The hotel, with its unique location on the Amstel, received its first guests in 1867 and has since been known for its majestic appearance and homely warmth. A True Original Celebrate the one-off craftmanship, the unique folklore and the 150 years of royalty-approved service that makes this hotel irreplaceable: a true one off. A milestone, which should be celebrated intimately or extensively, with your dearest friends, family and loved ones. At the Amstel Hotel, we put everything in motion to let you experience your dream wedding to the fullest. Boat tours The Amstel Hotel has been the trusted home of multiple boat companies for many years already. In cooperation with these permanent partners, we are happy to arrange beautiful arrangements for both business and festive cruises, where you can enjoy panoramic views from the Amsterdam canals. weddings at the amstel Experience the pinnacle of luxury on your wedding day at the Amstel Hotel, where every moment is an exquisite affair. With stunning venues offering iconic views over Amsterdam’s majestic Amstel River, and cuisine curated by our talented chefs, your celebration promises to be a day to remember forever. Let us orchestrate your dream wedding at the Grande Dame of Amsterdam, where timeless elegance meets unparalleled service. The whole team is truly delighted to look after you during your stay with us, and we are more than pleased to assist you in any way. Our beautiful terraces during the summer months are a real treat, while throughout the year our exclusive river boats outside the hotel enable our guests to tour the city’s historical canals. We happily take care of all requests and we strive to exceed your expectations”. column32: Do not expect a beer museum, but rather to be flooded with Heineken advertisements. A fantastic experience from start to finish. Plenty of interactive areas with a chance to receive all photo opportunities sent to your email for free. 3 beers available throughout and at the end of the tour per person. Staff are incredibly friendly and informative. Saooirse May. 2024 A brilliant experience! The staff were brilliant and we were all pleasantly impressed with how everything was. The extra price for the rooftop bar was worth every penny! It was a fun, informative and brilliant afternoon! Would definitely recommend, especially with friends. Ben Apr. 2024 On the VIP tour you see many parts of the old brewery not available to the general public. You end the tour in a private tasting bar. I won’t tell you how you enter it as I don’t want to spoil the surprise. We all agreed it was special... Dennis Apr. 2024 Absolutely brilliant! Really immersive and interesting, great gift shop and the beer was lovely. Definitely recommend as something to do on your trip to Amsterdam even if you don't drink beer.

The largest and most prestigious museum for art and history in the Netherlands: works by Vermeer, Rembrandt, and other Dutch masters. Its garden has a curious collection of architecture and has free entrance during museum opening times. Recommend to get there early to avoid long queues and crowds, then head first for the second floor to see the Rembrandt classics and others such as Avercamp's Winter Landscape with Skaters. column32: The Stedelijk Museum is the municipal museum of modern art. It has a long history, as it first opened in 1874 and has been at its current location since 1895. It was reopened in 2012 after a renovation that took four years: the newly constructed building is now locally referred to as the "bath tub" due its unique shape. The "bath tub" will host newly acquired film and video expositions, while the highlights remain in the old part of the building.

column32: This museum is dedicated to Vincent van Gogh, a late 19th century Post-Impressionist Dutch painter. The museum is extremely popular so expect to wait in line to get in. best to get there early (is a good cafe inside to keep you going). In the museum are many, but not all, of Van Gogh's works. The museum contains some famous paintings like ''Sunflowers'' and ''Potato Eaters'', but lack others such as ''Starry Night''. Also, there are selected works of Monet exhibited there. The audio tour at €5, in the language of your choice, will give you a much better understanding of Van Gogh's life and his paintings. column32: The only large park that is close to the Binnenstad, and definitely the most popular one. Nieuws en Feiten op hetVondelpark.net | Binnenkort enkele van Eeghen Wandelingen Vondelpark: 1 april 2024 door Hans Homburg Hans Homburg schrijft aan de redactie: "Vanaf dinsdag 2 april geef ik 2 natuur-historische rondleidingen per week door het Vondelpark. Op de dinsdagen en vrijdagen van 10 tot 12 uur. Tot eind juni 2024. Geen inschrijving vooraf, geen kosten. Voor maximaal 10 personen per keer. Voertaal is Nederlands. Startpunt is bij de monumentale ingang Van Eeghenstraat en omvat verschillende wandelingen in het oudste deel van het Vondelpark. Onderwerpen die ter sprake komen zijn: Piet van Eeghen en het oprichtingsbestuur van het park in relatie tot andere maatschappelijke projecten in de stad, ontwerper en aanlegger firma Zocher, de monumenten, bruggetjes en de gevarieerde groene invulling tot heden." Manke Nelis Is Niet Meer Vondelpark: 10 maart 2024, herzien donderdag, 14 maart 2024 In de avond van donderdag, 7 maart 2024 rond 17:30 heeft fotograaf Peter Wesche een gewonde Ooievaar aangetroffen langs een sloot op de Schapenweide. Hij waarschuwde de Dierenambulance, maar die kwam pas op vrijdag rond 10 uur in de ochtend. De vogel is diezelfde dag op weg naar de vestiging van de dierenambulance overleden. Bij navraag door Peter bleek het te gaan om Manke Nelis, de aan 1 poot manke Ooievaar-man van het nest op de Schapenweide, die voor vele nakomelingen in het Vondelpark heeft gezorgd. Deze vogel is vermoedelijk aangevallen en verdreven door een oude man(?) Ooievaar met aluminium lipring nr. 95 (boven) en 74 (onder). De ring zit om de om rechterpoot dus het werd geringd in een even jaar. Dat zal dan 2010 of 2012 zijn. Het ringnummer staat niet geregistreerd bij vogeltrekstation. De ringer heeft de gegevens dus nooit doorgegeven. Het vogeltrekstation gaat de ringer benaderen om alsnog de gegevens te krijgen. Zodra ze die hebben worden ze doorgegeven. Op het nest staat een nieuw paartje: de geringde 9574 en een ongeringde ooievaar. Die ongeringde is niet het vrouwtje van Nelis. Het vrouwtje van Nelis is sinds eind februari niet meer gezien. Bij het nieuwe paartje hebben we nog niet kunnen vaststellen wie het mannetje en wie het vrouwtje is. Op maandagmiddag gaat Peter naar de Dierenambulance om foto's maken van Nelis en evalueren wat er fout is gegaan. Zie ook waarneming.nl Mollentelling Vondelpark: 18 februari 2024 Jarenlang waren er geen mollen te vinden in het Vondelpark. De grondwaterstand is namelijk te hoog, en daarom lopen de gangen snel onder water. En dat vinden ze niet leuk. Maar afgelopen zomer, tijdens het ringen van de jonge ooievaars op de Schapenweide ontdekten wij enkele mollengangen. Waar komen die vandaan? Omdat de gangen alleen rond de nestpaal te vinden waren denken wij dat een mol gepakt was door een ooievaar, en tijdens het voeren aan de snavel ontsnapt is en naar beneden op de grond gevallen. De hoveniers van het park denken echter dat de mol samen met een vrachtje aarde geïmporteerd is. De Schapenweide is tijdens de afgelopen renovatie flink verhoogd, dus hier heeft de mol betere kansen. Dat is te merken omdat nu overal op de Schapenweide de molshopen te zien zijn. Hoeveel mollen er nu zijn is niet bekend. Omdat het Vondelpark ecologisch geïsoleerd is -vooral voor mollen, is het niet te verwachten dat de populatie zich zal uitbreiden. We zullen dit in ieder geval goed bestuderen. Nationale Mollentelling Hoe Gaat Het Met De Ooievaarsjongen? Vondelpark: 30 juli 2023 Paul Koene, die opkomt voor de ooievaars in het Vondelpark schrijft aan de redactie: Wat betreft nest naast Koeweide: Ooievaar 8E073 is inderdaad overleden op de Toevlucht. Had door de storm meerdere fracturen in de vleugels. Ooievaar met ringnummer 8E074 is vermist. Werd enige dagen na de storm voor het laatst gezien. Helaas is door de begroeiing het nest alleen van veraf goed te observeren. Rond de 12e juli kon je met een ingezoomde bridge camera (vergelijkbaar met een 1200 mm lens) of een goede kijker vanaf de weg, voorbij de ingang Koeweide, iets wits op het nest zien liggen. Maar niet duidelijk genoeg om een conclusie te trekken (waarnemingen van mij en Peter Wesche). De dagen daarop werd dat wit steeds minder goed te zien ( waarnemingen van mij en Peter Wesche vanaf ingang Koeweide en van Hannah Jansen vanaf de Koeweide tijdens haar vlindertelling) Kortom het zou dus goed kunnen dat 8E074 is overleden en op het nest ligt, maar 100% zekerheid hebben we niet. Wat betreft nest op Schapenweide: Op 12 juli rond 18.00 zijn de drie ooievaartjes van het nest gesprongen. Peter Wesche had net wat foto's van de drie gemaakt vanaf de westzijde, liep naar de zuidzijde van de Schapenweide en in die paar minuten zijn ze verdwenen. Ze hadden tot dat moment nog niet gevlogen, maar waren wel al ver gevorderd met hun vliegoefeningen. Er liepen op het moment van de verdwijning twee mensen op de Schapenweide, dus het is niet onaannemelijk dat die te dicht bij het nest zijn gekomen en dat er sprake was van nestverstoring. Na 21.00 uur wist een van de ooievaartjes, 8E071, met een onhandige landing, terug te keren op het nest. Op de 13e rond de middag landde de tweede, 8E072 op de Schapenweide. Vlak daarvoor was het op de Koeweide gezien. Dit jong heeft vervolgens een tijd op de Schapenweide gefoerageerd, onder begeleiding van zijn twee ouders en wist later in de middag het nest te bereiken. Van de 8E070 is niets meer vernomen. 8E071 en 8E072 kunnen nu goed vliegen dus af en toe zal je een leeg nest treffen, maar tegen de avond keren ze nog steeds terug naar het nest. Op 26 juli rond 17.00 uur heb ik ze daar nog gezien. Stronk van Populier Omgevallen Vondelpark: 12 maart 2023 Vannacht is een tien jaar oude stronk van een gekapte populier omgevallen. Het is een zeer oude zwarte populier, van het vrouwelijke geslacht. In het voorjaar was het hele plein bedekt met pluis, het leek wel een dik pak sneeuw. Omdat de boom begon over te hellen in de richting van het gebouw ernaast, besloot men de boom te kappen. Halverwege de kap bleek dat er vleermuizen in woonden, en zijn de werkzaamheden afgebroken. Alleen een flinke stronk bleef staan. Dat was 10 jaar geleden, en intussen verloor het al zijn bast, en werd de stronk steeds meer verrot. Afgelopen nacht is hij dan bezweken. Het viel dwars door het hek op het trottoir, een scooter verpletterend en een fiets beschadigend. Bij het schrijven van dit artikel is de stronk nog niet opgeruimd. Sportclubs Veroorzaken Veel Overlast Vondelpark: 21 januari 2021, aangevuld op vrijdag, 29 januari 2021 De Corona pandemie slaat hard toe. Mensen houden ramen en deuren gesloten en zitten bibberend van angst de hele dag thuis. En zo langzamerhand ziet men de weegschaal gevaarlijk ver naar rechts doorslaan. Dan komt natuurlijk de vraag: "Zal mijn bikini over een paar maanden nog wel passen?". En dan komt de grote beslissing. Om voor veel geld middagenlang in een strak nylonpakje achter een vent met een fluitje aan te hollen. Nu de sportscholen gesloten werden, wordt het Vondelpark als gratis uitwijkplaats gebruikt. Grote stukken openbare weg worden met pionnen afgezet, zodat de fietsers zigzaggend tussen de hinkelende sporters door moeten. Kinderen worden van de speeltuintjes weggejaagd omdat de trekelastieken aan de klimrekken bevestigd moeten worden. Argeloze wandelaars springen van schrik opzij als er weer een groepje komt aanstormen. HELP - Ik Heb een Pad in de Tuin! Vondelpark: 1 april 2018 door de Werkgroep Paddentrek Deze hulpkreet krijgen de vrijwilligers die bezig zijn met de paddentrek in het Vondelpark vaak. Daarom heeft het Natuur- en Milieuteam Zuid een werkgroep opgericht om bewoners met deze vraag te hulp te staan. Het is namelijk wettelijk verboden padden en kikkers te vangen en ergens anders uit te zetten. Ze horen in uw tuin, en sterker nog; het is goed voor uw tuin om deze dieren te hebben. Padden en kikkers zijn enorme veelvraten, en daarom zult u veel minder last hebben van slakken en insecten, en ander klein levend gekruip. De werkgroep bestaat uit ervarings-deskundigen die ook helpen bij de paddentrek in het Vondelpark, en bereid zijn bij u langs te komen om tips te geven hoe u uw tuin padvriendelijk kunt inrichten. En wees gerust, u hoeft van uw tuin geen veenmoeras of een jungle te maken, meestal zijn een paar aanpassingen voldoende. Heeft u een amfibie-vriendelijke tuin, dan is de werkgroep ook geïnteresseerd om van u te horen welke voorzieningen u heeft getroffen, en hoe dat werkt. Op de foto van Google-Satellite ziet u dat de tuinen in Zuid behoorlijk versteend zijn. Er kan nog heel wat gewonnen worden.

column32: Largest street market in Amsterdam, and the best-known street market in the country. It is iconic for the "De Pijp" neighborhood and its working class inhabitants. There is something for everyone here, whether you're looking for delicious Dutch treats, clothing or second-hand cameras. There's also a wide array of stores that cater to the city's Surinamese, Antillean, Turkish and Moroccan inhabitants, giving the market and neighborhood a strong multicultural feel. Can get very crowded, so watch out for pickpockets. De Albert Cuypmarkt; de mooiste markt van Mokum! De Mooiste Markt van Mokum is open voor uw dagelijkse boodschappen of een dagje uit. U vindt er alles om een lekker diner klaar te maken of te shoppen bij onze kleding en/of sieradenkramen. Want shoppen in de buitenlucht is tenslotte veilig!
Probably the wealthiest street of the country where Dutch celebrities go for a new pair of designer shoes. Better bring a filled wallet if you're planning to buy something here.

column32: Located just off the far end of the De Pijp neighborhood's famous the Albert Cuyp Market, Sari Citra is one of the most delicious and most affordable Indonesian restaurants in town. Be sure to try several of the selections as the friendly staff builds a plate for you. Don't show up right at 5PM unless you feel like waiting in line behind a lot of hungry locals just getting off work. Open during the week from 2PM-9PM, and from 3PM-9PM on weekends. In the close surroundings (about a hundred meters) of the Albert Cuypmarkt we are the perfect spot to take a moment of rest and to enjoy the traditional Indonesian kitchen. Just around the corner, a 5 minutes' walk, you will find the Heineken Experience. And more highlights of Amsterdam are close by. Within a 10 minutes walking distance you will find the Rijksmuseum, Museumplein and the Van Gogh Museum. Finish your day in Amsterdam with one of our great dishes like nasi or bami rames, sate ajam, gado-gado or our delicious en abundant dish "Sari Citra". In our cozy restaurant you will find an excessive selection of original Indonesian dishes on our menu, daily fresh and with care prepared. Where can you find us? A bit loud and boisterous for travelers looking to relax but perfect for those looking to meet people from all over the world and get the true "Amsterdam Experience". Lockers require lockpads, which are not available for rent, only sale for €5. Come experience the real hustle and bustle of Amsterdam at The Flying Pig hostels. Our three youth hostels are world famous for their relaxed atmosphere in a true Amsterdam style. The Flying Pig bars are the best place in town to meet other like-minded travelers, have a drink, a smoke, or an unforgettable party. Our rooms and dorms however, are kept silent and noise free to ensure a good night sleep. All essentials are included in the price of your hostel stay: clean bed linen, Wi-Fi, under-bed storage lockers (bring your own padlock), city maps, local hot-spot guides and of course the recommendations of our staff. Our hostels have too a fully equipped kitchen for you to cook your own meals and store your food. Buffet breakfast is available on site for just €7 per day. Forgot your towel, padlock or toothbrush? We've got you. You can pick these up cheap from our reception store.
